    • Method Detail

      • partition

        public static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> partition(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> liste,
                                                                         int taille)
                                                                  throws InvalidTaille
        Returns consecutive sublists of a list, each of the same size (the final list may be smaller). For example, partitioning a list containing [a, b, c, d, e] with a partition size of 3 yields [[a, b, c], [d, e]] -- an outer list containing two inner lists of three and two elements, all in the original order.
        Parameters:
        liste - the list to return consecutive sublists of
        taille - the desired size of each sublist (the last may be smaller)
        Returns:
        a list of consecutive sublists
        Throws:
        InvalidTaille - if taille is nonpositive or equal to 0
